message:
I fixed a quote.

This is the actual quote John Reid said: “Freddie actually wrote ‘Love Of My Life’ for David Minns. Freddie told me that. ‘Love Of My Life’ was for Minns.” This is taken from the book Somebody to Love: The Life, Death, and Legacy Of Freddie Mercury on page 115. 

Here is the inaccurate quote someone posted: “Freddie actually wrote ‘Love Of My Life’ for [his only love Mary]. Freddie told me that. “Love Of My Life” was for [Mary].” This is not the real quote.

The person who keeps adding this info is violating Wikipedia’s terms. They have already lied about a quote and now they are posting information that is speculation and not fact. Posting that Brian May said that “Mary Austin was the love of Freddie’s life” is not sufficient evidence. Also, as this user has stated, Freddie Mercury was still in the midst of writing the album, which this song is on. They conclude that this is “evidence” that the song cannot be about David Minns. He was still writ...
Someone keeps editing the page to make it seem like the song was for Mary Austin which is not accurate. There is no evidence to support this.
